Werewolves, a group of hunters on the prowl at night, are a popular element in both pop and furry cultures. But where exactly did these tragic creatures of beings originate, and how did they come to establish themselves in villages and wilderness?
This lecture will approach Werewolves from a historical and mythological perspective, using literature to consolidate its characteristics, explore its origins, uncover the veil of history, and understand how the lost wolf tribe faces modern society.
